channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Florida Is the Perfect Rent-to-Own Market—Should You Take Advantage?
item.description: The Sunshine State offers the exact combination of factors that make this investment option attractive.

item.title: Microsoft is launching its mobile game store in July
item.description: Microsoft will launch its own mobile game store in July, the company announced at the Bloomberg Technology Summit on Thursday. Xbox president Sarah Bond shared that the company plans to bring its first-party portfolio, which includes titles like Candy Crush and Minecraft, to the mobile store at launch. Microsoft then plans to open up the […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Rare Bright Spot for a Canine Lover Doing Time: Raising Puppies to Become Service Dogs
item.description: Adam Roberts reflects on the highs and occasional lows of training Labrador retrievers for the Puppies Behind Bars program.

item.title: A Healthy Lifestyle Can Add Years to Life, Despite 'Bad' Genes
item.description: Turn around those bad family genes with four lifestyle changes.

item.title: What If We Replaced Income Taxes with Property and Sales Taxes? Would Real Estate Investing Even Work?
item.description: A few reasons for—and against—this proposed shift in U.S. tax laws.

item.title: Oura launches two new heart health features
item.description: Smart ring maker Oura is launching two new features focused on heart health, the company announced on Friday. The first claims to help users get an idea of their cardiovascular age, while the second feature aims to estimate their cardio capacity. Depending on a person’s results, Oura will offer strategies on how to sleep, move, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins the Dart Award for “The Mercy Workers”
item.description: Our feature on mitigation specialists who help save people from the death penalty was recognized for making “significant contributions to public understanding of trauma-related issues.”

item.title: Taking Racism out of the Kidney Disease Equation
item.description: Kidney care in the U.S. is at a watershed moment of moving past a deeply entrenched, institutionally racist equation.

item.title: Couple Goals: Navigating Real Estate Investment Decisions With Your Significant Other
item.description: 7 steps to earn your significant other's support in real estate investing.

item.title: This Week in AI: OpenAI considers allowing AI porn
item.description: Keeping up with an industry as fast-moving as AI is a tall order. So until an AI can do it for you, here’s a handy roundup of recent stories in the world of machine learning, along with notable research and experiments we didn’t cover on their own. By the way, TechCrunch plans to launch an AI newsletter […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Weinstein Ruling Poses Quandary: Can #MeToo Coexist With Protections for Defendants?
item.description: Proving sex crimes often requires evidence that is generally excluded to protect the rights of the accused.

item.title: Plant-Powered Sleep: Vegan, Vegetarian Diets Unlock Extra ZZZs
item.description: Vegans and vegetarians sleep around 30 more minutes per night than average and up to 90% of them report good or excellent sleep quality, according to a new survey published by the Sleep Foundation.

item.title: Garena is quietly making India-themed games even as Free Fire’s relaunch remains doubtful
item.description: Garena is quietly developing new India-themed games even though Free Fire, its biggest title, has still not made a comeback to the country. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Lawmakers Considered Modest Public Defense Reforms. They Rejected All of Them.
item.description: With its refusal to impose oversight or consistent standards in local defense, Mississippi risks falling further behind rest of the U.S., critics say.

item.title: Anorexia: The Body Neglected
item.description: What, exactly, does anorexia nervosa do inside the human body? The heart and bones suffer the most.

item.title: Fisker Ocean faces fourth federal safety probe
item.description: The U.S.' NHTSA has opened a fourth investigation into the Fisker Ocean SUV, spurred by multiple claims of "inadvertent Automatic Emergency Braking." © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: In This Police Youth Program, a Trail of Sexual Abuse Across the U.S.
item.description: Explorer posts, overseen by the Boy Scouts, are supposed to foster an interest in policing. They have faced nearly 200 allegations of misconduct.

item.title: Postpartum PTSD: Right Diagnosis Can Help Mothers and Babies
item.description: Many new mothers aren’t aware that postpartum PTSD even exists, but it’s far from rare. Here's what to know.
